meanings.definition: The state or quality of being inoperative.
meanings.sent1: The inoperativeness of the old machine made it impossible to use.
meanings.sent2: The inoperativeness of the remote control was frustrating as it wouldn't change the channel.
meanings.sent3: The inoperativeness of the broken clock led to some comical misunderstandings about the time.
meanings.sent4: The inoperativeness of the traffic lights caused chaos on the busy intersection.
meanings.sent5: The inoperativeness of the elevator during rush hour created a sense of panic among the passengers.

meanings.sent1: The inoperativeness of the outdated software slowed down the entire system.
meanings.sent2: The inoperativeness of the leaky faucet wasted a lot of water.
meanings.sent3: The inoperativeness of the umbrella on a rainy day was quite inconvenient.
meanings.sent4: The inoperativeness of the worn-out brakes on the car was a serious safety concern.
meanings.sent5: The inoperativeness of the flashlight in the dark forest left them feeling vulnerable.
